sense.name: necessities
sense.commentary: the stock of basic facilities and capital equipment needed for the functioning of a country or area
sense.examples: America's infrastructure relies heavily on oil. Infrastructure can refer to roads, bridges, and rail lines necessary for industrial economy.

sense.name: substructure
sense.commentary: the basic structure or features of a system or organization
sense.examples: The financial infrastructure the large corporation was composed of many different departments. Environmentalism has an infrastructure of groups, committees, and admirers.
